meanings.definition: Act against (something) in order to reduce its force or neutralize its effect.
meanings.sent1: She tried to counteract the heat by turning on the air conditioner.
meanings.sent2: The medicine will counteract the allergic reaction.
meanings.sent3: He attempted to counteract the loud music by playing his own music even louder.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude helped counteract the negative vibes in the room.
meanings.sent5: Adding lemon juice can counteract the bitterness of the dish.

meanings.definition: Take action in opposition to (someone or something).
meanings.sent1: The team decided to counteract the opponent's aggressive strategy.
meanings.sent2: The protestors planned to counteract the new law with peaceful demonstrations.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly threatened to counteract her friend's prank with an even bigger prank.
meanings.sent4: His determination to succeed seemed to counteract any obstacles in his way.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's mission was to counteract the villain's evil plans.
